questions.question: I ............................... my knee while playing football yesterday.
questions.description: To hurt your knee is to injure it.

questions.question: Gargling with warm water will relieve the symptoms of a ............................... throat.
questions.description: This is an example of a collocation.

questions.question: A dentist can fix that ....................................
questions.description:
An ache is usually a mild discomfort that affects only a particular part of the body.
Pain is stronger.

questions.question: The blow made my head ......................................
questions.description:
An ache is usually a mild discomfort that affects only a particular part of the body.
Pain is stronger.

questions.question: The driver ....................................... himself badly in the accident.
questions.description: Hurt is usually used as a verb.

questions.question: The boy came home with a ...................................... knee.
questions.description: A hurt knee is an injured knee.

questions.question: The nurse bandaged my ..................................... toe.
questions.description: Like hurt, sore can also be an adjective.

questions.question: Losing the election was a .......................................... disappointment.
questions.description: This is an example of a collocation.

questions.question: The child's constant tantrums ......................................... his mother.
questions.description: Pained can mean agonized or distressed.
